title: Instant On Operating Systems(List any you know of)

forumNotes.author: Christian
forumNotes.content: So it looks like Presto will be debuting a new Instant ON OS with it's Beta release in 2 weeks... Interesting thing here is that it is Hardware Independent which is a nice twist to Instant ON systems. Looks like a linux distro, Any possibility in booting this thing up from grub4dos? You can sign up for beta testing on their site and take a look in a couple of weeks... [http://www.prestomypc.com/index.php](http://www.prestomypc.com/index.php "External link")

forumNotes.author: mr_
forumNotes.content:
This instant on concept are the future.  

[http://www.hyperspace.com/](http://www.hyperspace.com/ "External link") is similar to this but you can "alt + tab" to Windows, running parallel (but seams hardware dependant).  

I hope in future you just turn on your computer and you see your regular desktop (Windows, Linux, whatever you prefer) and you can do most things except "advanced" things such as saving (greyed out) which will be load and initialized in background while you can already start working.  

That's real innovation but we need to wait until Microsoft has finished Windows 7 + made enough money out of it + has adapted that idea. In meanwhile I would be glad if major linux distributions would copy that instant on concept.

forumNotes.author: MedEvil
forumNotes.content:
> This instant on concept are the future.
The future? You mean the past!   
Every home computer in the 80ies featured instant on OS! ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

Besides, use hibernation in Windows and you have instant on.  
For those more tech savy, there is also the 'hibernate once resume many' feature.  

I just wished the hibernation file would just have the size of the used defragmented ram, instead of the size of the total ram.  
That would improve wake-up times very much, on todays high ram machines.  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)
